title: Fidelity Teams Up With Ethic on ESG Investing
text:
Text size

Photograph by JB Reed/ Bloomberg News

Fidelity Investments said Wednesday it had teamed up with Ethic, which describes itself as a “tech-driven asset manager,” to allow financial advisors working with Fidelity to create personalized values-based portfolios for clients.

Newsletter Sign-up

Although investing using environmental, social, or governance (ESG) criteria has yet to go mainstream, interest in this approach is growing. ESG funds attracted $8.9 billion in the first six months of this year, versus $5.5 billion during all of 2018, the companies said, citing Morningstar data.
description: Financial advisors working with Fidelity will be able to use to Ethic’s technology to create personalized ESG portfolios for clients.
